definitions: To establish or create something, such as a business, institution, or system.
To arrange for something to happen or to be ready for use.
To prepare equipment or machinery for operation.
To trick or deceive someone, often to make them appear guilty of something.
To provide someone with the money or means to start a new life or venture.
examples: They plan to set up a new company next year.
Can you help me set up the new computer?
The technicians are setting up the sound system for the concert.
He felt like he had been set up by his former colleagues.
Her parents set her up with a deposit for her first flat.
